website_summaries.verdict: Although it is a well-made inverter with lots of built-in protections, its reliability tends to be questionable when powering appliances that pull a lot of power.
pros: Offers numerous outlets including USB port
Can power small items and minor appliances, as it features 1,500 watts
Has thermal, overload, and over, low, and under voltage protection
cons: Though rated for up to 1500 watts, some appliances tend to cause overload

customer_reviews.title: Great inverter, however the cables that come with it ...
customer_reviews.text: Great inverter, however the cables that come with it are way undersized. I tested it with a 12V 100AH battery and my meter showed me a constant load of around 20 Amp (240 Watt) on the input side. The cables got so hot after a while that you couldn't touch them any longer. I assume the inverter will run well with a full load, but I would advise against using the included cables and order a some higher gauge ones. After all I like the inverter, but will most likely ditch it for a 24V one as I could use less Amp's to have the same result and therefore make it more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Berger

customer_reviews.title: Nice Inverter, Works As Advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I used this inverter to power my side by side fridge from 60 feet away but I had to power my truck on to do it because of the length of the cord. It wouldn't work with the truck off. I used a 16 gauge extension cord. The fan never had to come on, there was NO heat build up even after several minutes, and the fridge ran smooth as normal. Powering the fridge during those rare outages is the main reason I purchased this item so I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: The Emerald Garden Lake Painter

customer_reviews.title: Significantly overrated
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up a 1500 watt hair dryer unit went instantly into alarm condition was running it with a 12v lithium iron phosphate battery pack capable of delivering 5000 watts of power
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. This unit does not drain when turn off ...
customer_reviews.text: The correct size is 15.8 x 9.3 x 4 and the weight is 9.9lbs for the 1500 watts unit. So far so good. This unit does not drain when turn off which is good so I can leave attached all the time. When turn on the drain is 1.4 amp. I have tested using a shop vac rated at 1000 watts with no problems. Glad I bought this as price just when up from $149.95 to 189.95 9/30/2016
customer_reviews.author: Bernard

customer_reviews.title: The remote switch is great, offering you an option to turn the inverter ...
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged with 4 awg cables. This is a large inverter, takes up some space but barely breathes hard when I use it to power a small 200w heater and 600w microwave. The remote switch is great, offering you an option to turn the inverter off and on away from the actual unit. This is not a convenient carry with you inverter. It's big and long and once you install it you won't want to keep moving it around. That switch comes in handy with something this big.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LIFE LINE MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: I used this to get from Louisiana a Houston hospital, powering my oxygen machine as I need a lung transplant and I am on the highest home oxygen flow there is. I consider the machine a life line and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: game consoles and 1/8 hp fan on the furnace easily, with the occasional vacuum cleaner or blender
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this unit based on price and review, I was in the market for a much more expensive name brand unit. Mine has been used daily on a bank of 6 golf cart batteries, for about a year and a half. It handles a small fridge, a chest freezer, 42" tv, game consoles and 1/8 hp fan on the furnace easily, with the occasional vacuum cleaner or blender. The remote allowed it to be easily placed in a ventilated machinery space without having to worry about constant access to it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Slow on delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12v system for a small refrigerator and it works well. However I tried to run my house 18c'' fridge and it cut off on startup of the cycle even though the batteries were fully charged. Not a soft start inverter and I don't believe the 1500/3000 rating.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Off grid living
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had it for 5 months now, powering my off grid home including washing machine and fridge. Initially used a car battery but now am using 4 l16 deep cycle 6v batteries. It Seems quite efficient, and uses only 7-8 watts (about 0.55 amps)

customer_reviews.title: THE BAD: -The fan is loud and annoying
customer_reviews.text: THE BAD: -The fan is loud and annoying. It's either full-on or full-off, and it kicks on at like 90 degrees Fahrenheit even when the inverter has no load at all! -The included cables can't handle the rated load. I ran a toaster, measured a draw of 1400W, and after 30 seconds the cables were too hot to touch. THE GOOD: -Absolutely everything else! The inverter is really a sine! Works great with power tools and my refrigerator. The included remote on/off switch is really handy! It's been working fine for the last 6 months. It's not a perfect inverter, but it's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Waveyard

customer_reviews.title: Well made, awesome tech service.
customer_reviews.text: Never had an inverter, was turning a cargo van into a mini RV. Learned how to wire an RV on Line, needed more info on what I needed for an RV. Technical service helped me focus my needs and select the best wattage unit(my daughter was in room when I was on phone and said she felt sorry for the tech guy). I hooked up the unit looks and works great, I sure It will provide good service.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent inverter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't put out nearly 1500w

Upgraded to 0 ga DC cables for the low voltage side. It runs smaller loads fine, but buzzes loudly and shuts off after 3 seconds with the microwave. Wish I tested it sooner so I could return it. Lesson learned: I won't buy from them again nor will I use them on the fleet of utility trucks I'm outfitting.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value, pure clean sine wave!
customer_reviews.text: I got this inverter for my Ranger Tug R21 Boat's Air Conditioner, it had an old non-sine inverter that kept going into error and shutting down and the AC was not efficient. This solved the problem, as the AC compressor and motor runs a lot more efficient with a pure sine wave. Great savings, as these pure sine wave inverters were a lot of $$$ just a few years ago. as you see by my scope the wave is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MikeD

customer_reviews.title: Lack of data for cable size
customer_reviews.text: I did a test on the unit at my remote camp with the microwave it will be running. I was impressed on the quiet operation. I will repost with an up date later after the permanent installation. What I didn't like was the lack of information of the cable size requirements. I had to go to another manufacturer page to use their information. I'm sure I over killed with 2/0 cable, but that was another company's data. Update, able to contact company and I was told #2 cable was sufficient. 1 year later, and still working outstanding.

customer_reviews.title: it works  great

customer_reviews.title: Terrific tech support
customer_reviews.text: I haven't really used the inverter yet but I'm very pleased with the customer service. In hooking this up to my 6V battery bank, I mixed up the positive and negative terminals. Sparks flew and I thought had ruined the inverter. Pete, the technical support person, was wonderful. He walked me through what to do and gave me additional support regarding wiring and the placement of the unit. He took the time I needed to help with everything I was worried about. Replacing the fuses was easy and I'm now back in business and much better prepared to finish the installation. Thank you Pete!
customer_reviews.author: Lynds

customer_reviews.title: It's a Best Value for the Price

The only ding I have against it is that it ships with battery connect cables that are too thin to allow it to reach full power. I had to go out and buy ($20) 2/0 cables to connect to the batteries so I could run this inverter at its rated power of 1,500 Watts.

customer_reviews.title: Well made.

I have also planned on using with a small solar set up. I have tested on a small power tool and it works as detailed. Fortunately I have not had an emergency situation to use it but I feel confident it will perform as it should. It is well made. I will update this when used more heavily.

customer_reviews.title: It works, but not at rated power output

Could not hold a load over about 900w for more than a few minutes before cutting off and beeping at me. This was installed with doubled up 2ga and over 400 amp hours of battery. Returned for a different brand.

Better that than burning down my RV while my wife blow dries her hair!

Update 10/9/2018. Replacement unit is working ok. I do not think the surge rating of 3000w is accurate. It will not power a 1100w microwave on full power. TIP: Lowering the power rating on a microwave to 70% or 80% allows it to not trip.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and much better than other inverters

The cooling fan doesn't even need to come on! Meanwhile the previous inverter fans would roar on just a 135w laptop load. I'm a happy buyer now. I have this inverter attached directly to 2 SLA 12v batteries in parallel which are being charged by a 270w panel on a Victron 75/15 Mppt controller. It's all working quite nice together now.

Unit lasted 6 hours. Load was 800 watts at the most, and only lights, no motors or any load that causes a surge on startup. The fuse mounts came unsolderd, and fell off the circuit board.
customer_reviews.author: scot d

customer_reviews.title: Simply an awesome inverter, totally love it
customer_reviews.text: This is like falling in love at 16 all over again, I've had all kinds of inverters before but never a pure sine wave one, this thing started up without as much as a whisper, the remote switch worked like a charm, it powered up a floor fan faster than the power company, no humming sound from the fan like my modified sine wave 3000 watts makes. This inverter stole my heart
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Max

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable, do not buy for installation in anything that moves.
customer_reviews.text: I've had it in a van for about a year now. It's broken twice. Once I was able to open it up and solder the connections that broke, but the second time it was just dead. A bunch of the chips are only held by thin metal tabs that are also functional; when they break, and they will in a moving vehicle, the inverter breaks. They need to redesign the build so the internal chips are held to the motherboard (or whatever it's called here) securely. If it's not screwed down, it will wobble until the metal fatigues and break eventually. Don't waste your money on this, it will not work reliably in a moving vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does seem to deliver the watts . . .

I've not hooked it up to a scope or anything, and I am going to get heavier cables for it. But so far, it seems to deliver and I'm satisfied.

customer_reviews.title: At first it looked good, solidly built and seriously looking
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to power up my RV's 110V appliances including 1500W microwave. At first it looked good, solidly built and seriously looking. It worked great powering laptops, tablets and all the low power stuff until I tried to plug in a microwave and then it tripped. So it is not providing 1500W as stated and unfortunately I still need to start my generator for 3 minutes if I need to heat up something in a microwave. In a couple of days I will try to plug in 1000W Instant pot, I hope it will provide at least 1kW. I'd say it is good inverter if you do not plan to use near 1500W of power.
